intro: Illigera trifoliata subsp. cucullata, commonly known as the hooded trifoliate, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round berries that mature to a dark color. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and habitat preferences.
